.entry-header
ABOUT THE CHAMBER
Committed to You
We Love Business
The Palm Bay Chamber is committed to helping local businesses thrive. Large or small, your business has a place with us at the chamber.
Join Now
Quick Facts About the Greater Palm Bay Chamber
Chamber funded by membership dues, sponsorships and events
Sponsorship opportunities available
Join Us Now
Great relationship with City of Palm Bay Officials
Volunteer positions are available
A Rich History
The Greater Palm Bay Chamber was founded in April of 1989 by seven individuals who realized the need for the growing Palm Bay area to have its own Chamber of Commerce.
Our Chamber is a non-profit and non-government business organization of professionals working together to enhance and promote the business community of South Brevard  County by providing economic leadership, knowledge & advocacy. We are a member-based organization supporting our member’s needs within the cities and towns of Palm Bay, West Melbourne, Melbourne, Malabar, Grant-Valkaria and members throughout Brevard County and beyond.
Join Now
Our Vision and Mission
Our mission is to serve, advocate and promote as the trusted voice for our business community.
Our vision is to To build, grow and expand South Brevard into an innovative, self-sustaining and economically diverse business community.
Values – DRIIVE
Diversity
Relationships
Integrity
Innovation
Voice
Education
Join Now
Who We Are
A private, nonprofit membership driven organization
An effective voice in representing the general business community in local, county, and state governments
A business resource whose strength lies in attracting the greatest number of members, creating a pool of resources from which ideas, energy and profits can be drawn
An action organization working to improve and build a better community
A professional organization for people who realize they can accomplish collectively what they cannot individually
The primary community-information resource center for visitors, current and future residents, relocating companies, business directories and relocation packages
“
I have been a member of the Greater Palm Bay Chamber of Commerce for several years now and am thrilled with being a part of this community. This Chamber is innovative, creative and strategic when it comes to programming and making connections! They serve as the trusted voice of our business community. Not only have I gained new business because of my involvement in the chamber it has elevated the visibility of my business as added more credibility to the work I do by providing me with opportunities to use my skill sets and strengths which position me as an industry expert.
Tracy Stroderd
The Palm Bay Chamber of Commerce truly connects business people with other business people to make things happen! The staff at the chamber is friendly and knowledgeable. They work hard to make sure you are getting the most out of being a part of the chamber. This is one institution that is an asset to the city of Palm Bay!
Keith Gee
I'm new to the chamber and since joining I've already gained more business opportunities! Nancy and her staff are outstanding.
David Jones
The chamber provides a great wealth of information, resources and support for any local business in Brevard County. Would highly recommend.
David Pett
I have been a member of the Palm Bay Chamber since 2015. The ladies who work there are friendly and helpful! If you are a business in Brevard County, I highly suggest you join the Palm Bay Chamber!
Shelley Kuhn
The Greater Palm Bay Chamber of Commerce is an excellent source of information, business contacts and opportunity to get involved in Brevard County. If you're a business owner I highly recommend you contact Nancy, Carolina, Cindy or Pat to discuss the impact the chamber can have on your business.
Adam Copenhaver
The Greater Palm Bay Chamber of Commerce is comprised of a wonderful Team of kind, helpful and very enthusiastic folks that help promote business in our specific area of S. Brevard County. Their networking events are top-notch and if your business is looking to expand and prosper, I highly recommend stopping by and meeting these fine people, and for the most benefit, consider becoming a member.
Boniface Hiers
Excellent organization helping the public find the best in professional services. Need a service provider? Look here first and browse the members.
Jesse Hall
Government & Legislative Affairs
Have Questions?
One of staff members would be happy to help!
Feel free to give us a call or send us an email
(321) 951-9998
info@greaterpalmbaychamber.com

Have Questions?

(321) 951-9998
info@greaterpalmbaychamber.com

Board of Directors
"Everything Rises and Falls on Leadership"
Dr. Lee Robertson
Our dedicated board of directors are both appointed and elected to their positions. They oversee the direction and keep the vision and mission front and center when making decisions.  We recognize and appreciate the competent and inspired leadership of our Board of Directors. Vision, purpose, and dedication to success are what defines this great team.

.entry-header
Chamber Leadership
Networking For Your Business
We Are Always Here To Help
Our Members  & The Community
Palm Bay’s future rests on our talented business leaders, committed civic officials and the unique sense of community solidarity that has held this city together for fifty years. We are quickly moving from the “City with a future” to the “City of the future.
For information on joining the Greater Palm Bay Chamber, please call (321) 951-9998 and we will schedule a convenient time to meet to discuss the many benefits of membership.
Grow your business and the community in 2025
PRESIDENT & CEO
Nancy Peltonen
CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER
Pat Luckey
Marketing & Communications Director
Carolina Rojas-Gee
MEMBERSHIP & DEVELOPMENT DIRECTOR
Cindy Hunt
Community Engagement Specialist
Tom Graver
Partner Relations Coordinator
Beverley Squire-Wiggins
PRESIDENT & CEO
Nancy Peltonen
Ms. Peltonen became President & CEO of the Greater Palm Bay Chamber of Commerce in September of 2015. During this time, Nancy has grown membership, increased programs to benefit Chamber members, implemented signature events and advocated on behalf of the business community at the local, state and federal level.
Nancy is a community leader who continues to volunteer for various non-profit organizations throughout Brevard County. Nancy has the unique skillset of having worked in profit and non-profit companies.
Nancy has a Master’s Degree in Management and Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing.
Email:
Nancy@GreaterPalmBayChamber.com
CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER
Pat Luckey
The Chief Operating Officer for the Palm Bay Chamber handles the day to day operations within the Chamber. Mrs. Luckey works with prospective and current members to assist them with their chamber benefits. In addition she oversees all financial duties including invoicing and accounts payable.
She has over thirty years experience in the office management and financial sectors working both in New York and Florida in the banking and health care fields and has an A.A.S certification in Accounting from CUNY La Guardia in Queens, NY.
Email:
Pat@GreaterPalmBayChamber.com
Marketing & Communications Director
Carolina Rojas-Gee
Carolina started at the Chamber as a volunteer in October 2015, and currently works as the Marketing & Communications Director. She has grown in the Chamber responsibilities. She is responsible for all communications through Social Media, Website, Emails, Presentations, Printings, Graphics, and all promotional material.
She works with the Multicultural Networking Group to make this community strong considering all the diversity and cultural richness in the area. She is originally from Colombia which makes this experience more exciting and relevant.
She has a Master’s Degree in Business Administration, and has over 20 years of professional experience in public and private industries in fields such as finance, marketing, projects development, statistics, research, and others.
Email:
Carolina@GreaterPalmBayChamber.com
MEMBERSHIP & DEVELOPMENT DIRECTOR
Cindy Hunt
Email:
Cindy@GreaterPalmBayChamber.com
Community Engagement Specialist
Tom Graver
Toms first Greater Palm Bay Chamber event was a ribbon cut in 1999. Since then, he has worked with many other Chambers in our three-county area as a volunteer, regular member, employee, and board member. He brings a unique perspective and is always willing to provide help. Tom is our Community Engagement Specialist.
After opening ESPN Wide World of Sports, he retired after 25 years with Disney World. Moving to Brevard County, he was the first manager for the River Lodge at Brevard Zoo, helped create the Space Coast Field of Dreams, and joined the opening team for the USSSA Sports Complex. Tom served on the City of Palm Bay Recreation Advisory Board and organized his neighborhood to build a playground. He continues to serve on several boards and community initiatives.
Tom and his wife have seven children and three grandchildren. He enjoys working in his yard, staying active with his kids or dogs, and collects vinyl records.
Email:
Tom@GreaterPalmBayChamber.com
Partner Relations Coordinator
Beverley Squire-Wiggins
Beverley and her family moved from England to Florida in April 2006 to co-own PIP Printing and Marketing Services, which they successfully sold in December 2018. She notes that their involvement in Chambers of Commerce was crucial for building relationships essential for business growth, highlighting the importance of community connections for lasting business success.
Beverley holds a Doctorate and a Master’s degree in Theology, along with a Postgraduate Diploma in Careers Guidance and an associate’s degree in business and finance. With over 25 years of experience, she has worked in local government, the non-profit, and private sectors.
Beverley is passionate about connecting with people and building strong relationships. She aims to leverage her entrepreneurial experiences to support prospective and existing Chamber partners.
Email:
beverley@greaterpalmbaychamber.com
Together, we can make a lasting change on the Space Coast.
Join Us Now
